title: How to tell which box has tools or ants

content.question: Two identical, unlabeled boxes are transported to an orbiting space station. The astronauts know that one box is filled with a light sample of ants for an experiment, and the other is filled with heavy tools for repairs. How can the astronauts tell, without opening the boxes, which box has the tools?

choices.label: Weigh each box on a spring scale. The box with the tools will have a higher reading.
Shake each box. The box with the tools will be harder to move back and forth.
Push each box. The box with the tools will travel farther before it stops.
Place each box on opposite sides of a balance. The box on the side that goes down lower will be the box with the tools.
Toss each box straight up. The box with the tools will go higher before coming back down.

content.answer: Shake each box. The box with the tools will be harder to move back and forth.
